activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:43 AM Defendant Jordan D Broaddus in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Jordan D Broaddus.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 22CF214 & 22CF224
Attorney Erdman relates & waives further reading. 
Preliminary hearings both set before Judge Boyle. 
Attorney Erdman waives time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jordan D Broaddus
Current: 1 E Eau Claire St, Rice Lake, WI 54868   (Effective: 11-02-2022)
Prior: 2136 20 1/8 Ave; #91, Rice Lake, WI 54868

10:07 AM Defendant Jordan D Broaddus in court.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Reporter appears by Zoom Video/Audio. 
Counsel not appointed yet.   Case reset to November 2nd before Judge Boyle with other file.  Reminder note given in court.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

10:53 AM Defendant Jordan D Broaddus in court.  Attorney Steuer appears by Zoom Video. Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court relates.  AIA set for 10/26/2022 at 10:00 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:07 PM Defendant Jordan D Broaddus appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Adrian W Longacre appeared by video for Jordan D Broaddus, for today.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 

State requests $2500.00 signature bond.
Court grants $2500.00 signature bond.
Next hearing to be in person in front of Judge Boyle.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
